title: Modern Task Management Application Playbook
summary: The playbook outlines a hybrid agile approach to deliver a secure, real‑time task management platform within four weeks, covering authentication, Kanban UI, CRUD, performance, and accessibility. It defines phased workstreams, measurable success criteria, and clear role responsibilities.

phases.name: Phase 1: Initiation & Requirements Finalization
steps: Conduct kickoff workshop with product and engineering leads
Finalize functional and non‑functional requirements
Define acceptance criteria and test matrix
Set up version control and CI/CD pipelines
Create sprint backlog and assign initial tasks

phases.name: Phase 2: Authentication & Core Infrastructure
phases.description: Implement secure sign‑in and foundational services
steps: Integrate Google and GitHub OAuth providers
Configure token storage and session management
Deploy backend services to staging environment
Implement role‑based access control scaffolding
Set up monitoring and error logging

phases.name: Phase 3: Kanban Board Development
phases.description: Build drag‑and‑drop Kanban UI with real‑time sync
steps: Design responsive board layout for desktop and mobile
Implement drag‑and‑drop interactions using a UI library
Integrate WebSocket or GraphQL subscriptions for live updates
Conduct cross‑browser and device compatibility testing
Perform load testing with 100 concurrent users

phases.name: Phase 4: Task CRUD & Data Management
phases.description: Develop and test full CRUD functionality
steps: Create RESTful endpoints for create, read, update, delete
Implement unit and integration tests for each endpoint
Persist tasks in the chosen database with proper indexing
Add validation for due dates, priorities, and labels
Run automated test suite and address failures

phases.name: Phase 5: Performance, Security & Accessibility
phases.description: Optimize, secure, and audit the application
steps: Optimize page assets to achieve <2 s load time
Enforce HTTPS, secure OAuth token handling, and password hashing
Conduct WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility audit
Run security scans and remediate findings
Finalize user onboarding documentation and training

considerations: Scalability of real‑time updates under peak load
Data privacy and compliance with GDPR/CCPA
User onboarding experience for new teams
success_criteria: Core functionality delivered and tested within 4 weeks
Authentication flows verified across Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge
Real‑time updates stable with ≥100 concurrent users
Kanban drag‑and‑drop functional on desktop and mobile
Task CRUD operations fully unit‑tested and integrated
Page load <2 seconds under typical load
Security controls (HTTPS, token handling, RBAC) enforced

roles.name: Project Manager
responsibilities: Coordinate sprint planning and stakeholder communication
Track progress against timeline and success criteria

roles.name: Frontend Engineer
responsibilities: Develop responsive Kanban UI and drag‑and‑drop interactions

roles.name: Backend Engineer
responsibilities: Build authentication services and OAuth integration
Develop and secure RESTful CRUD APIs
Implement database schema and real‑time sync endpoints

roles.name: QA Lead
responsibilities: Design test plans covering functional, performance, and accessibility tests
Execute manual and automated test suites
Validate success criteria across browsers and devices

roles.name: DevOps Engineer
responsibilities: Configure CI/CD pipelines and staging deployments
Set up monitoring, logging, and automated load testing
Manage HTTPS certificates and security hardening
